Landing.heroDescription: Interactive lessons, visual simulations, and hands-on labs to help you understand how the internet works.
Landing.feature1Desc: See how data moves with interactive visualizers.
Landing.feature2Desc: Practice with real-world scenarios and tools.
Landing.feature3Desc: From physical layer signals to application protocols.
Landing.feature4Desc: Master framing, error detection (CRC), and MAC addressing fundamentals.
Landing.feature5Desc: Understand TCP/UDP, flow control, and how reliability is achieved.
Landing.feature6Desc: Deconstruct HTTP, DNS, DHCP, and other protocols that power the web.
Landing.ctaDesc: Join thousands of students mastering computer networks through visualization. No sign-up required.
Landing.featuresSubtitle: From the physical cables to the applications you use every day.

NetworkDelay.desc1: The time required to push all the packet's bits into the wire.
NetworkDelay.feature1: Depends on data size, NOT distance.
NetworkDelay.desc2: The time it takes for a bit to travel from one end of the wire to the other.
NetworkDelay.feature2: Depends on distance, NOT data size.
NetworkDelay.result: Result: Transmission takes ~2.3 hours, while propagation is instant (5ms)!

crc-check.title: Cyclic Redundancy Check (CRC)
crc-check.description: Learn how to detect errors using polynomial division.

ip-addressing.title: IP Addresses & Classification
ip-addressing.description: Class A, B, C, D, E and special addresses.

subnetting.title: Subnetting & CIDR
subnetting.description: How to slice networks into smaller pieces.

Labs.title: Interactive Labs
Labs.description: Hands-on tools to visualize and experiment with core networking concepts.

signal-encoder.title: Signal Encoder
signal-encoder.description: Visualize Manchester and Differential Manchester encoding waveforms.

network-delay.title: Network Delay Calculator
network-delay.description: Calculate transmission and propagation delays interactively.

ip-analyzer.title: IP Address Analyzer
ip-analyzer.description: Analyze IPv4 addresses, classes, and binary formats.

routing-sim.title: Routing Simulator
routing-sim.description: Visualize Dijkstra's algorithm for finding the shortest path.

dhcp-sim.title: DHCP Simulator
dhcp-sim.description: Visualize the DORA process for dynamic IP assignment.

crc-calc.title: CRC Calculator
crc-calc.description: Generate error detection codes using polynomial division.

subnet-calc.title: Subnet Calculator
subnet-calc.description: Split networks into subnets and calculate masks.

dns-resolver.title: DNS Resolver
dns-resolver.description: Trace the path of a DNS query from client to authoritative server.

IpAddressing.title: IP Address Classes
IpAddressing.description: IPv4 addresses are divided into 5 classes (A-E) based on the leading bits.
IpAddressing.privateDesc: Not routable on the public internet.

Subnetting.title: Subnetting & CIDR
Subnetting.description: Subnetting allows you to divide a single network into smaller logical networks (subnets) by borrowing bits from the host portion of the IP address.
Subnetting.calcDesc: Use the tool below to visualize how borrowing bits increases the number of subnets but decreases the number of hosts per subnet.

RoutingAlgorithms.basicsDesc: Routing is the process of selecting a path for traffic in a network or between or across multiple networks.

static.title: Static Routing
static.desc: Routes are manually configured by a network administrator.
static.consDesc: Hard to maintain, no automatic rerouting.

rip.title: RIP (Routing Information Protocol)
rip.desc: A Distance-Vector protocol that uses hop count as a metric.

ospf.title: OSPF (Open Shortest Path First)
ospf.desc: A Link-State protocol that maintains a full map of the network topology.

Dns.title: Domain Name System (DNS)
Dns.description: The phonebook of the internet. Translates human-readable domain names (google.com) to IP addresses (142.250.191.196).
Dns.recursiveQuote: "Hey, find this for me and don't come back until you have the answer."
Dns.recursiveFlow: Client → Local DNS → Root → TLD → Auth → Local DNS → Client
Dns.iterativeQuote: "I don't know, but here is who you should ask next."
Dns.iterativeFlow: Local DNS asks Root ("Go to .com") → Asks .com ("Go to google.com") → Asks Auth ("Here is the IP")

Dhcp.title: Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP)
Dhcp.description: Automatically assigns IP addresses and other network configuration to devices on a network.
Dhcp.discoverDesc: Client shouts: "Is there a DHCP server here?" (Broadcast)

DelayCalculator.title: Network Delay Calculator
DelayCalculator.description: Calculate and visualize Transmission vs. Propagation delay.
DelayCalculator.oneDesc: High to Low transition (Manchester) / Transition at start (Diff Manchester)
DelayCalculator.zeroDesc: Low to High transition (Manchester) / No transition at start (Diff Manchester)
DelayCalculator.diffDesc: Transition at middle of bit interval is for clocking only.
DelayCalculator.diffOneDesc: No transition at start of interval.

SignalEncoder.title: Signal Encoder
SignalEncoder.description: Visualize Manchester and Differential Manchester encoding.
SignalEncoder.manchesterRule3: Transition always occurs in the middle of the bit period.

CrcCheck.title: CRC Check
CrcCheck.description: Cyclic Redundancy Check for error detection.
CrcCheck.step2: Divide modified message by G using XOR.

CrcCalculator.title: CRC Calculator
CrcCalculator.description: Generate error detection codes using polynomial division.

IpVisualizer.title: IP Address Visualizer
IpVisualizer.description: Visualize IP address classes and binary representation.
IpVisualizer.label: IP Address

DnsResolver.title: DNS Resolver
DnsResolver.step3: Root Server refers to TLD Server
DnsResolver.step5: TLD Server refers to Authoritative Server
